abstract: Joe Nocera Sports Business column examines personal-injury lawsuit filed by fan Andy Zlotnick against New Yankees and Major League Baseball after he was struck in face by foul ball during game and severely injured; Zlotnick claims that his vision was obstructed by umbrellas, making it impossible for him to react early enough to avoid being hit; Zlotnick has asked Yankees organization to follow lead of major league stadiums that ban use of umbrellas, except during rain delays, but has had no response.
lead_paragraph: A baseball fan injured by a foul ball is challenging the notion that major league teams can avoid liability with their assumption of risk doctrine.

headline.main: Danger at the Ballpark, and in a Baseball Ticket’s Fine Print
headline.print_headline: Danger at Ballpark (And in a Baseball Ticket’s Fine Print)
